definition[0]: used when saying what bad thing will happen if something is not done
example[0]: You’ll have to go now, otherwise you’ll miss your bus.
example[1]: Put your coat on, otherwise you’ll get cold.
definition[1]: used when saying what would have happened or might have happened if something else had not happened
example[2]: We were delayed at the airport. Otherwise we would have been here by lunch time.
example[3]: They got two free tickets to Canada, otherwise they’d never have been able to afford to go.
definition[2]: except for what has just been mentioned
example[4]: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
example[5]: people who smoke or otherwise abuse their bodies
